light_cleaned_title: There are too many people complaining against Supreme Court slowness and inefficiency who are also de facto stubbornly against any modernising reform.
light_cleaned_selftext: The Supreme Court receives a lot of criticism [such as here](https://www.bqprime.com/opinion/whats-choking-the-indian-judiciary). Much of it is fair, constructive criticism. ​ However, many people are against the Supreme Court's inefficiency, but ridiculously stubbornly against any modernising reform to the legal system. The most obvious recent example being the proposal for a uniform civil code, even in general. (I think there should be separate codes for marriage, adoption, inheritance, and miscellaneous social stuff.) ​ Even people who would cry evil üòà if those very India's marriage laws they de facto want on the books were proposed today. ​ However, some people just complain about literally any modernising reform that is not servile to their ideology. Simply helping their ideology is not enough. Such as with this [really very politically neutral criminal law reform](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-66495428). These people are just complaining for the sake of complaining. If they wanted more, they could easily just say they want more reform and be happy they are getting some progress. ​ Most tellingly, these people have no idea where they want major modernising reform to happen in the legal system, where their ideology is not concerned. It is as if they believe laws made centuries ago are sacred and have no superior alternative. Outdated laws are the very thing grinding down judicial progress, as they make lawyers and then everyone else dig through outdated laws and trying to twist them into modern sensibilities. Plus, it means the courts üßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è‚öñÔ∏è are over reliant on precedent, so you have to dig through old cases to prove something everyone thinks is obviously supposed to be in the law. ​ These modernising regressives just want to have their cake and eat it. A completely efficient judiciary without any effort done to modernise it. And especially not a single shred of focus on anything except their ideology. ​ Plus, they always want more money on their pet projects rather than effort and institutions. More and more frivolously spent money.
